metadata.dc:author: Laval R, Enrique
metadata.dc:description: With the foundation of the Medical School of 1833, the figure of Pedro Moran, the first professor of anatomy, physiology and hygiene, stands out. Diverse comments of his acts are recounted, some praising him and others revealing his concealment during the heat of the battle. His humble origins, competence and perseverance in the fulfillment of the teaching duties are extolled.
metadata.dc:title: El doctor Pedro Morán, la Escuela Médica de 1833 y la batalla de Rancagua.
[Dr. Pedro Morán, the medical school of 1833, and the battle of Rancagua].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista chilena de infectologia : organo oficial de la Sociedad Chilena de Infectologia
